Dickson Student Council is putting together a video for Homecoming. We need photographs and short videos that show what Dickson Homecoming was like ¨back in the day¨, and Keylee Mathews and her committee will create a video for everyone to enjoy.

2) What was the best game you ever played in?

3) What events were there during Homecoming Week when you were at Dickson, and what were they like?

4) What is the funniest or most spirited thing you ever saw at a pep rally?

Submit your photos or videos to webmaster@dickson.k12.ok.us, or plee@dickson.k12.ok.us

*Staff Spotlight*

As anyone who visits our campus can tell, we are currently remodeling several sections of campus, mostly out of the bond money which we received due to our amazingly supportive community. On top of all of this, our maintenance crew have built road barricades to funnel traffic for temperature checks in the morning, put together locations for alternative playgrounds due to the construction, and have been remodeling the original school cafeteria in order to house a special education room, a music classroom, and an additional classroom.

Today, they are working on the roof of that building. And if you look very closely, you can also see Mr. Colclasure, Superintendent of DPS, helping out this Friday morning!

We are so proud of our maintenance crew, headed up by Cody Bynum! They are ALWAYS willing to help anywhere they need to, including directing traffic, moving furniture around for teachers, and joining the custodial staff in cleaning the cafeterias after lunch. Thank you!

*Staff Spotlight*

In preparation for this upcoming school year, our Upper Elementary, Middle School, and High School staff were tasked with becoming experts on the Google Suite, as we are a Google School and will be using Google Classroom in all of our classes from 3rd-12th grade. In order to do this, the district purchased online training through MobileMind so as to prepare the teachers for their Google Educator Level 1 and Level 2 Certifications. Both tests are 3 hour practical exams, proctored online by Google.

As of today, the 63 teachers enrolled in the courses have completed 1415 modules on MobileMind and eight have earned their Level 1 certification. We were happy to team up with the K20 Center at OU in order to pay teachers $150 for taking the Level 2 certification exam, of which we already have two!

We appreciate their adaptability during these times, and their dedication to our students always!

IT Director Cindy Stinson, her son (a Dickson HS student) Sam Stinson, MS teachers Melissa Waller and Sherry Cargal, and MS/HS librarian Kandi Schuler have been working COUNTLESS hours inventorying, labeling, and setting up all of these devices. Not only have they been working on the actual technology, but they have also set up the pick-up times (July 27 and 28 from 9am-12pm and 4-7pm) with parent training. What an incredible group. We appreciate you all 💙
